Module flag4j
Package org.flag4j.arrays.dense

Class Tensor

java.lang.Object
org.flag4j.arrays.backend_new.AbstractTensor<Tensor,double[],Double>

org.flag4j.arrays.backend.DoubleTensorBase<Tensor,Tensor>
org.flag4j.arrays.backend.DenseDoubleTensorBase<Tensor,CooTensor>
org.flag4j.arrays.dense.Tensor
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, DenseTensorMixin<Tensor,CooTensor>, TensorBinaryOpsMixin<Tensor,Tensor>, TensorMixin<Tensor,double[],Double>, TensorPrimitiveOpsMixin<Tensor>
public class Tensor extends DensePrimitiveDoubleTensorBase<Tensor,CooTensor>

A real dense tensor backed by a primitive double array.

A tensor is a multi-dimensional array. If N indices are required to uniquely identify all elements of a tensor, then the tensor is considered an N-dimensional tensor/array or a rank-N tensor.

The AbstractTensor.entries of a Tensor are mutable but the AbstractTensor.shape is fixed.

See Also:

    • inv

      public Tensor inv(int numIndices)

      Computes the 'inverse' of this tensor. That is, computes the tensor X=this.inv(numIndices) such that TensorOverSemiRing.tensorDot(TensorOverSemiRing, int) this.tensorDot(X, numIndices)} is the 'identity' tensor for the tensor dot product operation.

      A tensor I is the identity for a tensor dot product if this.tensorDot(I, numIndices).equals(this).

      Parameters:
      numIndices - The number of first numIndices which are involved in the inverse sum.
      Returns:
      The 'inverse' of this tensor as defined in the above sense.
      See Also:
      • inv()

    • inv

      public Tensor inv()

      Computes the 'inverse' of this tensor. That is, computes the tensor X=this.inv() such that this.tensorDot(X) is the 'identity' tensor for the tensor dot product operation.

      A tensor I is the identity for a tensor dot product if this.tensorDot(I).equals(this).

      Equivalent to inv(2).

      Parameters:
      numIndices - The number of first numIndices which are involved in the inverse sum.
      Returns:
      The 'inverse' of this tensor as defined in the above sense.
      See Also:
      • inv(int)

    • toCoo

      public CooTensor toCoo()
      Converts this dense tensor to an equivalent sparse COO tensor.
      Returns:
      A sparse tensor equivalent to this dense tensor.

    • toVector

      public Vector toVector()
      Converts this tensor to an equivalent vector. If this tensor is not rank 1, then it will be flattened.
      Returns:
      A vector equivalent of this tensor.

    • toMatrix

      public Matrix toMatrix(Shape matShape)
      Converts this tensor to a matrix with the specified shape.
      Parameters:
      matShape - Shape of the resulting matrix. Must be broadcastable with the shape of this tensor.
      Returns:
      A matrix of shape matShape with the values of this tensor.
      Throws:
      LinearAlgebraException - If matShape is not of rank 2.

    • toMatrix

      public Matrix toMatrix()
      Converts this tensor to an equivalent matrix.
      Returns:
      If this tensor is rank 2, then the equivalent matrix will be returned. If the tensor is rank 1, then a matrix with a single row will be returned. If the rank of this tensor is larger than 2, it will be flattened to a single row.

    • toComplex

      public CTensor toComplex()
      Converts this tensor to an equivalent complex tensor.
      Returns:
      A complex tensor equivalent to this real tensor.
